title: Interactive English Education Project for Non-Native English-Speaking Mathematics Practitioners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English grammar and conversational proficiency, and understanding of foundational mathematical concepts (e.g., equations, functions, statistics)
context.additional_context: A program for current professionals aiming to improve practical English communication skills linked to math domains (e.g., data analysis, engineering design). Content is designed to integrate mathematical problem-solving processes with English expression.

learning_goals: Generate and perform at least five workplace conversation scenarios utilizing mathematical terminology (e.g., equations, graphs, statistics) and formulas

Analyze feedback from English conversation models to improve pronunciation and grammatical errors related to mathematics (e.g., pronunciation of 'variable', sentence structure for 'probability') by at least 80%
Acquire English presentation skills applicable to real-world mathematical work environments (e.g., data analysis report presentations) through PBL task performance
Secure at least two hours of self-directed learning per week through interaction with conversational learning models and link it to mathematical problem-solving skills

resources: English Instructional Materials for Mathematics Domain

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
